channel.title: Logging into the forum with bash cURL
channel.description:
How can I login to this forum using cURL in bash?
I've tried this: [code=bash]curl --data "user=Rixxx;passwrd=passwordhere;cookielength=-1;hash_passwrd=" -H "Expect:" -b "mpr_agree4=yes" -b "cookies.txt" -c "cookies.txt" -A "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/535.2 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu/10.04 Chromium/15.0.874.106 Chrome/15.0.874.106 Safari/535.2" "http://moparisthebest.com/index.php?action=login2"[/code]
Using this will only fill in the username form: <dd><input type="text" name="user" size="20" value="Rixxx;passwrd=passwordhere;cookielength=-1;hash_passwrd=" class="input_text" /></dd>
How can I fill in the other forms? I've tried replacing each ; with & but no data is sent.

item.title: Logging into the forum with bash cURL
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Rix_:

I’m no longer sending data to the forum via cURL. TehSpede suggested that I use a cookie file with cookies from my browser, therefore I’m already logged in.

i think this is what rapidshare does with their client

Read full topic
item.source: Logging into the forum with bash cURL

item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

I’m no longer sending data to the forum via cURL. TehSpede suggested that I use a cookie file with cookies from my browser, therefore I’m already logged in.

Read full topic
item.source: Logging into the forum with bash cURL

item.title: Logging into the forum with bash cURL
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

You have to sniff the packets when logging into the forum to get the actual data sent. Firefox’s Temper Data https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/tamper-data/, First you send the header information, then you send the data after.

Problem i noticed in your code “action=login2” should be used as a POST parameter
seems it’s like

"&action=login2&user=usernameHere&passwrd=passwordHere&cookielength=-1&submit=Login"

Read full topic
item.source: Logging into the forum with bash cURL

item.title: Logging into the forum with bash cURL
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

First of all, you should be using www.moparisthebest.com not just moparisthebest.com (curl probably handles the redirect, but it can’t hurt).

It’s like that in the actual bash script. What about second of all?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:1, topic:426470”]@Nueb35: You only URL encode values of the POST variables.
@Pwnd: … are you being serious?[/quote]I was seriously stoned.

Read full topic

item.title: Logging into the forum with bash cURL
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:4, topic:426282”]That doesn’t work either, it sends no data. When I use curl -F instead, the username form is filled in as:
user=Rixxx%26passwrd=passwordhere%26cookielength=-1%26hash_passwrd=[/quote]Are you for fucking real… Put your password where it says “passwordhere”

lmfao.

That’s one problem at least.

Edit: Unless being stoned has made me see something… that is nothing…

Read full topic
